website_summaries.verdict: Various features make this inexpensive bending tool easy to use.
pros: Easy to see angle markings and built-in levels
Rugged foot pedal creates consistent bends
High level of accuracy at a great price
cons: This option does not ship with a handle
Able to bend fewer sizes than other models

customer_reviews.title: Use water pipe for handle
customer_reviews.text: Don't buy the expensive handles they recommend for these. Go to you favorite hardware store and get a 42 inch piece of water pipe for $6.
customer_reviews.author: Bogan

customer_reviews.title: Works great and will save you money.
customer_reviews.text: I kind of didn't want to buy this. I thought maybe I should buy pre-bent pieces and fittings but when I totaled the cost, it wasn't even close. Those pre-bent pieces and fittings are very expensive and I would have spent around double for my fairly small project. With this, I can tackle my future projects without forking over a lot of money. One regret is that I wish I had purchased 3/4" one instead of 1/2" for more flexibility.
customer_reviews.author: Chae

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely invaluable for careful bending of heavier tubing, but ...
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely invaluable for careful bending of heavier tubing, but a long and strong "stick" is necessary. Rather than pay the exorbitant prices for a length of steel, there are cheaper substitutes that fit.
customer_reviews.author: M  Clement  Hall

customer_reviews.title: GETS THE JOB DONE!
customer_reviews.text: Works perfect I love the built in levels everyone will call you lazy but it’s so handy and quick and easy to use! Would recommend to anyone that bends pipe!
customer_reviews.author: Tanner

customer_reviews.title: I really like the arrows on the Gardner Bender tools
customer_reviews.text: I really like the arrows on the Gardner Bender tools. So easy for an older guy to see and read. They work awesome too. Perfect 90's
customer_reviews.author: Jerry D. DeLay III

customer_reviews.title: Tubing bender
customer_reviews.text: This tool allows me to make custom Yamaha golf cart tail pipes. Easy to ise
customer_reviews.author: Ed Carl

customer_reviews.title: Level makes it Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Very strong and the level makes it easy to see when you have the right angle. Used both sizes for a big project (maybe 50 bends) and they made it easy and quick!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This tool makes a perfect 90 degree bend, I was amazed.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry D. DeLay III

customer_reviews.title: Dont buy for the level viles
customer_reviews.text: Total crap first use, one 90° bend with a kick. Lay bender down and level viles fall out.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Henley

customer_reviews.title: Level makes it Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Very strong and the level makes it easy to see when you have the right angle. Used both sizes for a big project (maybe 50 bends) and they made it easy and quick!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased
customer_reviews.text: My old bender was a Greenlee set (3/4 and 1/2) I purchased several years ago. Well, after considerable use they finally bit the radish. Purchased these, and put them to use right away. So far I am very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: AVDOC

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: I thought it would include the handle. Returned the product.
customer_reviews.author: Aron Oakley

customer_reviews.title: Missing item
customer_reviews.text: Item was missing bending manual. I would like a manual sent to me please.
customer_reviews.author: Gma Jubrey

customer_reviews.title: Excellent bender!
customer_reviews.text: Can't beat the value and price! I originally was looking on Craigslist for a used bender, but nothing came close to this one with the bubble level. I'm thinking that the only way to break the bubble is to continually drop the bender/handle after using it (which we all do), so I wrapped some bubble-wrap around the handle about mid-way up. Problem solved! Highly recommend! This thing will last forever!
customer_reviews.author: Sparky

customer_reviews.title: Excellent bender!
customer_reviews.text: Can't beat the value and price! I originally was looking on Craigslist for a used bender, but nothing came close to this one with the bubble level. I'm thinking that the only way to break the bubble is to continually drop the bender/handle after using it (which we all do), so I wrapped some bubble-wrap around the handle about mid-way up. Problem solved! Highly recommend! This thing will last forever!
customer_reviews.author: Sparky

customer_reviews.title: Great tool !
customer_reviews.text: I'm just a hobby guy....this is an easy to use, fun little tool. I've been experimenting with thin wall conduit tubing. If you follow the directions, it's accurate and easy to duplicate bends. I hooked it to a 5 foot pipe for leverage and that's plenty.
customer_reviews.author: John P. Quinn

customer_reviews.title: Does not include a manual
customer_reviews.text: I will update this when I finally use it later on, but it does not come with a manual, unless you include the few pictures on the back of the box as being a manual. UPDATE: turns out I received a 931 bender (does not include a manual) in a 931B box, so I am returning it and hope to receive the proper item, with the manual as well. FINAL UPDATE: I returned the item for an exchange, and I got the same thing, a cheaper 931 bender in a 931B box, and again, no manual, so I am dropping my star rating to perhaps gets their attention, and getting a refund. I'll try another brand.
customer_reviews.author: Doc

customer_reviews.title: It's pretty good for the price
customer_reviews.text: It's pretty good for the price. I like the levels, and the degree markers, however it doesn't give the length to measure for the stub, like other benders I've seen.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Kennedy

customer_reviews.title: meh - works ok
customer_reviews.text: The level bubble was broken when it arrived, and to get a precise bend is difficult with half inch. But it worked for what I needed. If you are looking for cheap, this is your tool.
customer_reviews.author: M. Ahlers

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a replacement for the one I broke. It is great. It is like the one I broke..
customer_reviews.author: Rich D. Sizemore

customer_reviews.title: Bends but mars
customer_reviews.text: I have only lightly used, but until I filled down the edges there were dimples where it gripped the conduit.
customer_reviews.author: Redswar01

customer_reviews.title: Quality product
customer_reviews.text: This is well made and does the job. It's made of aluminum with built in level. Great for the price I paid. Thanks.
customer_reviews.author: Mark A

customer_reviews.title: pipe bender
customer_reviews.text: Happy with this item , just wished it would have been delivered to the right place took longer to receive ,due that it was delivered to someone else ,other wise item does work fine for my projects
customer_reviews.author: Ernistine

customer_reviews.title: Bender for a professional electrician
customer_reviews.text: Yeah I said it. This bender is for real electricians, not you homeowner boys and guys that run a little conduit in a basement once a year. It has two levels for 45 and 90 degree bends. I love a Gardner bender because you get more bend for your buck. I mean that when the handle is straight up and down on a Gardner bender your conduit is bent to 45 degrees, not thirty degrees like a Klein or Ideal. The levels make bending even short 90s easy because they are always true.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Good for 3/4 EMT
customer_reviews.text: The design is a good one but only for 3/4" EMT. If you use smaller 1/2" EMT the tool is off and 90 degree bends are trial and error and the level is inaccurate. I bought this pipe bender with the expectation that it would work well for both 1/2" and 3/4" EMT but found this to not be the case. If I was going to bend a lot of 1/2" EMT I would buy another bender for this purpose.
customer_reviews.author: WinterTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: wrong bender
customer_reviews.text: I recived diferent b ender biger heavy now i have to pay for shipping back
customer_reviews.author: marcius

customer_reviews.title: Works very well, and the level is nice to have!
customer_reviews.text: I have had a 1/2 bender for years, but when I decided to install solar on my home, I elected to use 3/4 conduit for which I did not have a bender. I bought this and it worked very well. I was quite happy with it for the 6 bends or so that I needed to do! I'm glad to have it around, though, and even those few bends were definitely paid for in the savings.... And, yes, the solar was permitted and is producing the energy I'm using to write this review. Good bender...
customer_reviews.author: Albert Einstein

customer_reviews.title: INCORRECT DESCRIPTION.
customer_reviews.text: In the item description, it is said this bender " bends 1/2" to 1-1/4" EMT, and 1/2" to 1" rigid and rigid aluminum conduit." This is not true. This bends ONLY 3/4 EMT and 1/2 rigid tube. You must purchase a different head for each size of tubing. There is nothing wrong with the tool that I am aware of; but the description should be changed.
customer_reviews.author: Duane

customer_reviews.title: No manual needed
customer_reviews.text: If you need a manual to know how to use a bender, leave it to the pros.
customer_reviews.author: Sean Jones

product_meta.title: Gardner Bender 931B Aluminum Conduit Hand Bender Tool, Bends ¾ Inch EMT & ½ Inch Rigid Aluminum Conduit, 6 Inch Bending Radius, Acrylic Level Gauge, Embossed Sight Line Angles, Fits BH-75 Handle
product_meta.description:
Size:¾ Inch EMT / ½ Inch Rigid| Style:Head OnlyGardner Bender 931B Aluminum Conduit Hand Bender Tool, Bends ¾ Inch EMT & ½ Inch Rigid Aluminum Conduit, 6 Inch Bending Radius, Acrylic Level Gauge, Embossed Sight Line Angles, Fits BH-75 Handle

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
Gardner® Thinwall Pipe Bender, 3/4" EMT, 1/2" Rigid, IMC, model GB 931B. Built-in acrylic level gauge helps make precise bends in half the time. Includes embossed sight lines for 10deg, 22.5deg, 30deg, 45deg, 60deg, and 90deg. Patented Vise-Mate holds conduit steady as it is cut to appropriate size. Bend radius 6".
feature_bullets: Vise-Mate holds conduit while cutting or reaming
Built-in acrylic level gauge helps make precise bends in half the time
industry-standard markings - 30° bend when handle is straight up
Bends ¾ Inch EMT, and ½ Inch to 1 Inch Rigid Aluminum Conduit

specifications.Size: ¾ Inch EMT / ½ Inch Rigid
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars79 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
